text: Acleris youngana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Alabama, Maine, New Hampshire, Ontario, Pennsylvania, Quebec, Vermont and West Virginia.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 15–18 mm. The forewings are light grey-brown with scattered black sprinkling. The hindwings are pale smoky.McDunnough, J. 1934. The Canadian species of the Tortricid genus Peronea. Canadian Journal of Research, 1934, 11(3): 290–332 Adults have been recorded on wing from April to May and from October to November. ==References== youngana Category:Moths of Canada Category:Moths of the United States Category:Fauna of the Northeastern United States Category:Fauna of the Southeastern United States Category:Moths described in 1934
title: Acleris youngana
